main event: On May 1, 1957, two orange objects, the size of basketballs, were observed 170 miles southwest of Santa Rosa Island, California. The objects appeared to be afterburners on two jets, passing over at 10,000 ft. and 6,000 ft. with one observed at 9,000 ft.
interesting points: Observer mistook the objects for afterburners of jets due to their appearance.
Objects were observed flying at different altitudes, one passing over and the other passing under an aircraft in flight path.
One of the objects passed from east to west at 12,000 ft and the other from west to east at 8,225 ft.
The observation lasted approximately half a minute.
The report was made by a military 2nd Lieutenant, adding credibility to the witness.
sighted object: Two orange objects the size of basketballs in the sky
location: 170 miles southwest of Santa Rosa Island, California
